required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiofrequency-based Speckle Tracking Echocardiography to Evaluate Diastolic Function
clinical_study.official_title: Radiofrequency-based Speckle Tracking Echocardiography to Evaluate Diastolic Function

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate a novel ultrasound system's ability to assess the relaxing properties of the heart compared to current techniques.

primary_outcome.measure: Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate During Isovolumic Relaxation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment
primary_outcome.description: Diastolic circumferential strain rate during isovolumic relaxation is a novel measure of diastolic function that measures the rate of relaxation of the left ventricle during the interval of isovolumic relaxation (the period of active relaxation). We would expect that a higher value reflects better relaxation, and better diastolic function.

primary_outcome.measure: Early Diastolic Mitral Annular Velocity (E-prime) Using Tissue Doppler
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment
primary_outcome.description: E-prime is a conventional commonly-used parameter of diastolic function. Higher values of E-prime typically reflect better diastolic function.

intervention.description: Each subject will undergo scanning using the investigational echocardiography system (Ultra DCI Model 5000)to measure Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate during Isovolumic Relaxation (DCSR-IVR) as novel measure of diastolic function.

Each subject will undergo echocardiography using a conventional echocardiography machine to evaluate the early diastolic mitral annular velocity (E-prime) using tissue Doppler as a standard measure of diastolic function.

Each subject will undergo standard echocardiographic measure of the mitral inflow pattern and invasive catheter-derived measure of left ventricular end-diastolic pressure to determine their diastolic function. This evaluation will be used as the gold standard for this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled to undergo a clinically indicated left heart cardiac catheterization will be recruited for the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected acute ST elevation myocardial infarction.
- Acute coronary syndrome with active ongoing chest pain
- Known or suspected acute aortic dissection
- Known or suspected cardiac tamponade
- Known history of unoperated constrictive pericarditis
- Known or suspected severe aortic stenosis or severe mitral regurgitation
- Heart rhythm other than sinus rhythm on pre-cath EKG
- Age < 18 years old
- Unable to provide informed consent

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: All study participants underwent measurement of Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate during Isovolumic Relaxation as well as measurement of E-prime by tissue Doppler. They also all had evaluation of their diastolic function by the combination of their mitral inflow pattern and invasive measure of left ventricular end-diastolic pressure.

outcome.title: Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate During Isovolumic Relaxation
outcome.description: Diastolic circumferential strain rate during isovolumic relaxation is a novel measure of diastolic function that measures the rate of relaxation of the left ventricle during the interval of isovolumic relaxation (the period of active relaxation). We would expect that a higher value reflects better relaxation, and better diastolic function.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment
outcome.population: Only 26 subjects had adequate images for assessment of DCSR-IVR and had gold standard assessment of diastolic function, and the analysis was limited to these subjects.

group.title: Normal Diastolic Function
group.description: These were the subjects deemed to have normal diastolic function using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP <= 15 mm Hg).

group.title: Grade 1 Diastolic Dysfunction
group.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 1 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A < 1.0).

group.title: Grade 2 Diastolic Dysfunction
group.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 2 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP > 15 mm Hg).

measure.title: Diastolic Circumferential Strain Rate During Isovolumic Relaxation
measure.description: Diastolic circumferential strain rate during isovolumic relaxation is a novel measure of diastolic function that measures the rate of relaxation of the left ventricle during the interval of isovolumic relaxation (the period of active relaxation). We would expect that a higher value reflects better relaxation, and better diastolic function.
measure.population: Only 26 subjects had adequate images for assessment of DCSR-IVR and had gold standard assessment of diastolic function, and the analysis was limited to these subjects.

outcome.title: Early Diastolic Mitral Annular Velocity (E-prime) Using Tissue Doppler
outcome.description: E-prime is a conventional commonly-used parameter of diastolic function. Higher values of E-prime typically reflect better diastolic function.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed from echo obtained at time of enrollment
outcome.population: Only 25 subjects had adequate images for assessment of DCSR-IVR and interpretable tissue Doppler and gold standard assessment of diastolic function, and the analysis was limited to these subjects.

group.title: Normal Diastolic Function
group.description: These were the subjects deemed to have normal diastolic function using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP <= 15 mm Hg).

group.title: Grade 1 Diastolic Dysfunction
group.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 1 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A < 1.0).

group.title: Grade 2 Diastolic Dysfunction
group.description: These were the subjects deemed to have Grade 2 diastolic dysfunction using the gold standard assessment of mitral inflow and LV end-diastolic pressure (E/A 1 - 2 and LVEDP > 15 mm Hg).

measure.title: Early Diastolic Mitral Annular Velocity (E-prime) Using Tissue Doppler
measure.description: E-prime is a conventional commonly-used parameter of diastolic function. Higher values of E-prime typically reflect better diastolic function.
measure.population: Only 25 subjects had adequate images for assessment of DCSR-IVR and interpretable tissue Doppler and gold standard assessment of diastolic function, and the analysis was limited to these subjects.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
